data.name: Nonozle
data.detailed_description:
Nonozle is a game where you solve puzzles by filling in pixels to form an image. This style of puzzle is called a nonogram.

Every row and column of a nonogram has one or more number hints attached to it, and each number represents a contiguous group of filled in pixels. Using these hints, you can figure out which squares should be filled in and which ones should be blank, and thus fill in the puzzle one step at a time until it forms a complete image.

Features

  • 200 hand-made nonograms to solve, ranging in size from 5 by 5 to 25 by 25
  • Solve puzzles in any order
  • Unlimited undo and redo
  • Optional warning for when the puzzle is filled incorrectly
  • Tutorials and step-by-step puzzle solution examples
  • Mouse, keyboard, and controller support
  • Highly customizable
    • Light, grey, and dark themes
    • Selectable main color for each theme
    • Numerous gameplay and appearance options
    • Full control remapping
  • Supports up to 8K resolutions, as well as ultra-wide aspect ratios
  • Arbitrarily high refresh rate support (240+)
  • Chill electronic soundtrack

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
  • Processor: 64-bit processor that can run Windows.
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphics that support DirectX 11. For high resolution (8K), high frame rate (240 fps), and/or multi-sampling, a discrete GPU may be necessary.
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 290 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: The minimum resolution supported is 800 by 480. A 720p or higher monitor is recommended. Not tested on Windows 7, 8, or 8.1, but may work.
